data:
Persuader: Hello.
Persuader: How are you?
Persuadee: I'm good, how are you doing?
Persuader: Very well.
Persuader: I'm just up organizing info for my charity.
Persuader: Are you involved with charities?
Persuadee: Yes!
Persuadee: I work with children who have terminal illnesses.
Persuadee: What charity are you involved in?
Persuader: That's great!
Persuader: I help with Save The Children.
Persuadee: Amazing!
Persuadee: Working with kids is the best.
Persuadee: What do you do for Save the Children?
Persuader: I help raise donations and volunteer time.
Persuadee: That's so important.
Persuadee: How do you raise donations?
Persuader: By directly asking for aid.
Persuader: Do you currently donate to your charity?
Persuadee: Yes I do, but I'm happy to donate to yours as well!
Persuader: Wonderful!
Persuader: Would you be will to donate $1.00 of your task money to help Save the Children?
Persuader: Save The Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
Persuadee: Yes, I would be happy to!
Persuader: Would $2.00 be too much to ask?
Persuadee: No, I can do it.
Persuader: Thank you.
Persuader: Can we make it $1.50?
Persuader: These children really need the assistance.
Persuadee: $1.50 sounds good then.
Persuader: Why not $1.75 then? :-)
Persuadee: I can do $2.00!
Persuadee: Happy to help.
Persuader: Thank you so much!
Persuader: Do you have any more questions for me?
Persuadee: Nope.
Persuadee: Thank you!

data:
Persuader: Hey there, are you one to donate to charities?
Persuader: Because I have a great one that you could take a look at.
Persuadee: i usually do donate to charities
Persuader: Oh really?
Persuader: I bet Save the Children could be right for you though.
Persuader: From the task you are doing, you can donate as much or as little as you like.
Persuadee: I would like to know more about this charity
Persuader: Save the Children is and how your donation is essential to help ensuring children's rights to health, education, safety, etc.
Persuadee: I'm surprised i've never heard about it! how do i know if it's legit and if money really go to help those kids
Persuader: It's a very legitamate charity.
Persuader: There are millions of children that need help and just as many people that are willing to donate for the children.
Persuadee: i understand but i just don't feel comfortable donating yet.
Persuader: How much money do you spend on unnecessary stuff like a bag of snack or candy?
Persuader: Think about that and from what you spend on candy and snacks can be money that goes to a child in real need.
Persuadee: I'm currently receiving food stamps so i don't buy candy and unnecessary stuff.
Persuadee: i'm super broke right now
Persuader: I can understand that.
Persuader: Even if you may have a few pennies that are left around can be collected and help the children. Would that be something you are willing to do?
Persuadee: yes, i guess i can.
Persuader: That is great!
Persuader: Anything, even a few cents, will definitely help in the long run.
Persuader: Even a few pennies tha tyou will earn from this task will help.
Persuader: That sounds wonderful, doesn't it?
Persuadee: it does.
Persuadee: i really love helping people
Persuader: It is a wonderful feeling to help someone and I'm glad that you feel the same way.
Persuader: I bet others you know will do the same when they see you donating to a great cause.
Persuadee: Yes, i agree
Persuader: That is awesome.
Persuader: Well I hope you have a great day!
Persuadee: thank you!
Persuadee: You too!
Persuader: Oh, one little thing.
Persuader: How much would you like to donate?
Persuadee: I'm not sure yet, maybe 5 cents
Persuader: 5 cents it is.
Persuader: Thanks!

data:
Persuader: Good Morning!
Persuader: How are you today?
Persuadee: I am good.
Persuadee: It's really nice outside where I am so I am sitting outdoors.
Persuadee: How are you
Persuader: Oh, that sounds nice.
Persuader: I am well. It looks nice here today as well.
Persuader: What are your plans today?
Persuadee: I have to go to work at 11:30-6.
Persuadee: But its ok, I work every Sunday.
Persuadee: So we are supposed to chat about a children's charity.
Persuadee: What are your feelings?
Persuader: Yes, I was just reading about the charity myself.
Persuader: I was going to make a plea and ask if you would be willing to donate to Save the Children.
Persuader: It helps kids in need.
Persuader: I would hate to think a child would die with no food when I could ask people to help.
Persuader: Can you donate part of today's pay?
Persuader: Even a bit?
Persuadee: It's so sad to me that anyone should go without food in our modern world.
Persuadee: So I would definitely be willing to help.
Persuader: Yes, I agree, it is sad.
Persuader: That is great that you can help!
Persuader: How much of today's pay can you give?
Persuader: Also, please include the $ sign with your pledge.
Persuader: Thank you!
Persuadee: I think the bonus of today is 2 dollars so maybe if we both give half of it?
Persuadee: That is at least something.
Persuadee: I only wish that our Government would help the poor more than they do.
Persuadee: What do you think?
Persuader: I would love to help as well.
Persuader: Can you pledge with the $ sign in your next reply.
Persuader: Also, I agree, the gov't should do more.
Persuader: And thanks for asking me too.
Persuadee: So lets agree we both can give $1 of of bonus.
Persuader: I would say that is a wonderful idea.
Persuader: If you are willing to give then I will too!
Persuadee: Nice!!!
Persuadee: It's not a huge amount but unfortunately I have expenses and 2 kids of my own to support.
Persuadee: Do you have kids?
Persuader: Yes, I do.
Persuader: I could not imagine having to watch any child suffer, much less my own.
Persuader: Have you visited the Save the Children website?
Persuadee: I have not visited the site but I have heard of them before.
Persuadee: I am one of those people who cant watch the commercials of the suffering kids or pets.
Persuadee: It really upsets me
Persuader: I looked at the site.
Persuader: Have you heard about the recent storms/flooding in Hawaii?
Persuadee: A little bit but not much.
Persuadee: I have been following politics and things are going crazy.
Persuadee: I am hoping that things will change soon.
Persuader: Well, it looks like the STC is already to help the children there.
Persuader: I am amazed by their swift response.
Persuader: Isn't it really great!
Persuadee: That is great that they are there helping.
Persuadee: Maybe they learned something from the mess in Puerto Rico.
Persuadee: The conditions there were really bad but the US gov really dropped the ball on helping.
Persuader: Yes, I am sure that is it.
Persuader: I have to thank you again for your $1 donation.
Persuader: It will go to great use I am sure.
Persuader: Do you have any questions about the charity?
Persuadee: Not really.
Persuadee: I truly believe that most charities are so needed in these times when the governments and the corporations aren't being super charitable.
Persuadee: I do like to look and see what the overhead is of the charities to see that the CEO‚Äùs aren't being overpaid

data:
Persuader: Have you ever heard of the charity children?
Persuadee: I don't think so, what do they support?
Persuader: I'm sorry.
Persuader: It's save the children.
Persuader: My fingers don't type very well.
Persuader: It's an international nongovernmental organization.
Persuader: They are looking out for children's rights in developing countries
Persuadee: Oh, yes.
Persuadee: I do know save the children.
Persuadee: They are a great organization.
Persuader: That's great news, you know they are untrustworthy.
Persuader: Have you ever donated to them?
Persuadee: I haven't donated to them, which is good apparently.
Persuadee: What makes them untrustworthy?
Persuader: Oh my goodness I meant to say trustworthy.
Persuadee: ha, that is much better.
Persuadee: I don't have a lot of income to donate to charity :(
Persuader: I don't either, and when I do I usually donate to dog charities.
Persuader: LOL but after reading up on this they said every penny helps.
Persuader: I think I could spare .25.
Persuader: Do you want to kick in a little?
Persuadee: I donate to a dog charity also!
Persuadee: such sweet creatures.
Persuadee: I have a dachsund/pit mix named Tuttle.
Persuadee: I can spare a quarter if it helps.
Persuader: That's why we don't have extra money.
Persuader: LOL I have a Labrador who eats everything and this shepherd beagle mix.
Persuader: They are my children .
Persuader: But I guess once in a while we should donate to real children LOL .
Persuader: Okay cool I'll donate 1/4 and you donate 1/4 and then we've done our good deed for the day!!!!
Persuadee: Sounds good to me.
Persuadee: We could donate our earnings from this hit and still make a nickel for kibble.
Persuader: Lmao!
Persuader: Deal!!!
Persuader: Have a great day from Illinois!
Persuadee: Thanks, warmest regards from Alabama
Persuader: I guess we have to each have 10 turns so after this response we have to write two more times LOL
Persuadee: I was wondering that.
Persuadee: Are you a cubs fan?
Persuader: Not really but I've been to one of their games.
Persuader: It was fun.
Persuader: Are you?
Persuadee: I don't really have a team, but I like baseball.
Persuadee: What are your dogs names?
Persuader: Clementine and Eddybear.
Persuader: And they are tired of me messing around on the computer so after the survey we are going to go for a walk!!
Persuader: I think we took ten turns!
Persuadee: Enjoy they walk, I hope it isn't too hot like here.
Persuadee: we have to walk early and late.
Persuadee: It's really hot here too.
Persuadee: Okay I'll put it in my quarter if you put in yours and have an awesome day!
Persuader: It's really hot here too.
Persuader: Okay I'll put it in my quarter if you put in yours and have an awesome day!!

data:
Persuader: Hello
Persuadee: hi!
Persuader: How's it going?
Persuadee: It is going alright, thanks
Persuader: Did you have any interesting dreams?
Persuadee: I did actually, but i can't remember the.
Persuadee: what donations are we talking about?
Persuader: It\'s for "Save the Children"
Persuadee: what is it abuot?
Persuader: It promotes children's rights and provides relief in developing countries
Persuadee: weell that sounds like a lovely charity.
Persuadee: are you donating?
Persuader: Yeah I'm going to donate a couple dollars after this.
Persuader: Do you think you will, too?
Persuadee: I wish I could give more, but I am broke
Persuader: How much would you give if you weren't?
Persuadee: i would give it all if i weren't
Persuader: Are you going to donate anything at this time?
Persuadee: I may give a few cents
Persuader: I think that's fair
Persuadee: How about you?
Persuader: I was thinking I'd give $1.50 or something
Persuadee: That is very generous!
